event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian forces destroyed three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system, along with illumination and guidance radar, using the Iskander OTRK. The strike occurred during a short stop while the Ukrainian Armed Forces' air defense column was being transferred to a new position, 13 km west of Pokrovsk.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Destruction of the Patriot air defense system west of Pokrovsk🔺A video of the defeat of a convoy of launchers and escort vehicles of an anti-aircraft missile system appeared on March 9. Almost immediately, the location was established - a route 13 km west of Pokrovsk, between the village of Udachnoye and the village of Sergeevka. Details According to preliminary data, as a result of the use of the Iskander OTRK, three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system were destroyed along with the illumination and guidance radar.

Compared to typical targets such as a stand-alone radar or launcher, such a “catch” suggests that the Russian missilemen “caught” the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ air defense column at the most opportune moment to hit it—during a short stop while being transferred to a new position.

It is noteworthy that the three destroyed launchers are actually half of the SAM battalion of this type (a full MIM-204 Patriot battery includes up to eight launchers).

Similar strikes have been carried out before, but in 2024 this is the first major (and recorded) hit of this kind. What conclusion can be drawn? Taking into account the transfer of the Patriot air defense system to Pokrovsk (and further east, towards Avdeevka) and other air defense systems, including both Western ones, So the Soviet, operational-tactical aviation of the Russian Aerospace Forces began to pose a mortal danger to the Ukrainian army, and a large number of air defense systems (both Soviet and Western) are needed in order to try to solve this problem.

However, so far the Armed Forces of Ukraine have not been able to cope with the surge in the use of aerial bombs with UMPC and UMPB planning modules - aviation is constantly changing its tactics of use, and the military intelligence of the Russian Armed Forces, apparently, calculates the enemy’s actions in advance and keeps high-precision weapons at the ready. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front.Military ChronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

event: Officer Returned from SVO Due to Fraud
description: Special forces officer Arzu Akhmedov was returned from the SVO due to a fraud case involving a 5,000-ruble microloan. Akhmedov claimed he forgot to repay the loan on time, but eventually repaid it two months later. Despite this, a criminal case was opened against him for credit fraud, and he was convicted and fired in March 2023.
original:
Forwarded from: Baza
An internal service officer of the GUFSIN was returned from the SVO due to fraud of 5 thousand rubles. He forgot to repay the microloan on time.

In February 2022, special forces officer Arzu Akhmedov took out several microloans: about ten of them for 5 thousand rubles each. I repaid all my debts on time, except for one. According to Arzu, he simply forgot about the last 5 thousand and gave them two months later than he should have. Afterwards, the man left for the Northern Military District and, while he was at the front, he learned that a criminal case had been opened against him for credit fraud. At the same time, the organization did not file a lawsuit against Akhmedov and did not notify him of the overdue debt.

When applying for the loan, Akhmedov indicated a different place of work, so investigators opened a criminal case for theft of funds. Arzu himself claims that he wrote the wrong title by mistake, and simply forgot to give 5 thousand. At the same time, he indicated the remaining data (passport, address, phone number and income level) correctly.

According to him, he signed an agreement to write off money from his account if he did not pay on time, but it was not written off. He was unable to set up auto payment: he couldn’t find the organization he needed in the bank’s app.

Due to a criminal case, the officer was seconded from the SVO. In March 2023, he was convicted of fraud and fired from his job. In October 2023, the cassation court overturned the verdict and returned the case to the prosecutor. However, recently charges of fraud were brought again, despite the fact that the debt was repaid by Akhmedov a month before the initiation of the criminal case.

description: The Russian army has begun using the UMPB ammunition, a unified interspecific glide ammunition capable of being launched by both aviation and the Tornado-S system. It is similar to the GBU-39/B SDB bomb used by the US for air strikes and the GLSDB ammunition used by Ukraine with the HIMARS MLRS.
original:
#SVO@mpre_view1
Some details have emerged about the newest UMPB ammunition, which recently began to be used (https://t.me/milinfolive/101817) by the Russian army.
Show more
Reportedly, the full name UMPB D-30SN stands for Universal Interspecific Glide Ammunition with a diameter of 30 cm.
This product is a unified ammunition capable of being launched both by aviation (then the bomb does not yet have a jet engine) and the Tornado-S system (then the bomb is equipped with an engine).
Thus, the UMPB is not a conceptual analogue of the Powered JDAM, as previously assumed, but rather of the GBU-39/B SDB bomb. This aerial bomb is used by the United States for its direct purpose for air strikes, and in the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine the GBU-39 is used together with the engine from the M26 rocket as part of the GLSDB ammunition (https://t.me/milinfolive/116333) for launching from the HIMARS MLRS.

event: US Prepares for Russian Nuclear Strike on Ukraine
description: In late 2022, the US prepared for a potential Russian nuclear strike on Ukraine, despite lacking concrete intelligence on Russian nuclear force mobilization. The Biden administration's assessment was based on a combination of events, analysis, and sensitive new intelligence.
original:
The United States was preparing for a Russian nuclear strike on Ukraine. As CNN reported, citing American officials, at the end of 2022, the United States was preparing for a possible Russian strike on Ukraine using nuclear weapons. And this despite the fact that they had no intelligence on the mobilization of Russian nuclear forces.

One senior source said the Biden administration's assessment was "not just one indicator, but a combination of events, analysis and highly sensitive new intelligence." Another source also confirmed that the concerns "were not just hypothetical" but were based "on some information received."

However, at the same time, CNN stated that the United States has never found intelligence indicating that Russia is preparing forces for a nuclear strike. When I got very scared and forgot to check the facts.🔶Foreign Media - the main international

event: Forging of Key Blanks for Low-Power NPP
description: AEM-Spetsstal has begun forging key blanks for the low-power nuclear power plant project using RITM-200N reactors. The blanks will be used to manufacture shells, flanges, rings, and other elements of the reactor plant.
original:
Forwarded from: Time - forward!
RUSSIA HAS STARTED FORGING BILLTS FOR THE FIRST LANDSCAPE LOW POWER NPP USING RITM-200N REACTORS

The AEM-Spetsstal company has begun forging key blanks for the low-power nuclear power plant project. In the future, shells, flanges, rings, bottoms and other elements of the newest RITM-200N reactor plant will be made from them.

Forging of blanks is carried out at an automated forging complex, one of the largest in Europe. It is capable of producing billets of any configuration from ingots weighing up to 440 tons. After completing all production cycles, including thermal and mechanical processing, the blanks will be shipped to other Rosatom enterprises for further assembly into finished products.

Casting of the first steel for the ground-based ASMM project blanks at AEM-Spetsstal began in December 2023. At the moment, the plant is the flagship for the production of metallurgical blanks for the creation of all types of nuclear installations of Russian design. Blanks are in production, from which VVER reactor vessels will be subsequently manufactured for 12 new power units of nuclear power plants in India, Turkey, Egypt and other countries. In addition, the company produces blanks for reactor installations of the RITM-200 type, which will be installed on floating power units.

The nuclear power plant in Yakutia, based on the RITM-200N reactor unit with a capacity of 55 MW, acts as Rosatom’s flagship project in the segment of ground-based SNMMs. It is based on the RITM-200N reactor installation. The thermal power of RITM-200N is 190 MW, electrical power is 55 MW. Service life - 60 years. Reactors of the RITM series are considered as one of the most promising areas for the development of global low-power nuclear energy.

Source: Rosatom#timeforward!

description: A communications project was set up in units at the front, with a focus on providing a safe and reliable communication solution. The project involved distributing radios and modernizing them for tanks, with the help of volunteers and technicians.
original:
About the communications project! Friends, we continue to set up communications in units at the front.

The other day, a reader who helps the front a lot, both with friends from his region and through me, contacted me with a proposal to try to organize a communications gathering in his region.

As a result, I explained to him that it is not necessary to hand over money or even walkie-talkies to me, but my main task is to distribute a safe and reliable communication solution at the front. That is, if you yourself provide assistance to some departments, I am ready to advise the communications department, connect you with technicians who will install the firmware and share the improvements they have developed.

So, together with volunteer Natalya from Moscow, we closed a communications project for one of the brigades in the Avdeevsky direction - she carried out the main supply, we added a little radios and paid for their modernization for tanks, and my comrades taught them the intricacies of their work.

But technology does not stand still - we are now already working on a new upgrade of the entire architecture and at the end of March we will be testing new solutions to improve our architecture. According to forecasts, this will greatly add to the versatility of our network.

This is exactly what I see as my main mission - to find innovations that will multiply our divisions and organize the creation of pilot projects, and then start the implementation process.

And I believe that in terms of communications it has already, in fact, been implemented, because more and more departments are seeking advice and copying our architecture.

Thank you, friends, for your trust.

Unfortunately, few people understand that effectiveness is not measured by the number of video and photo reports.

I could buy 30 thermal imagers for 3 million rubles and distribute them to 15 units, dropping a bunch of reports, but we spent about 15 million on the 2nd Army, now we are moving towards this amount in the 2nd Army Corps, and in parallel, by the end of March we will begin improvements in 2 Army and in the 132 brigade. That is, only 3-4 units, but that’s about 40,000 soldiers on call.

Communication is important. event: Discussion on Air Defense and BECs
description: The assessment of air defense on BECs from the enemy's side highlights the importance of regular patrolling of the water area by Inokhodets-type UAVs with guided missiles. This would prevent serious problems and ensure the safety of warships. The use of light patrol boats, turrets, heavy machine guns, and rapid-fire cannons is also crucial for detecting and destroying BECs.
original:
But the assessment of the topic, air defense on BECs, which I recently discussed, is only from the enemy’s side.

As we can see, the details are quite seriously worked out, and we must take into account that they do not post all the information in the public space. Therefore, we can expect that the degree of readiness is much higher than just reasoning on the topic.

Therefore, without normal regular patrolling of the water area by an Inokhodets-type UAV with guided missiles on board, there could soon be serious problems.

Why such a UAV? The flight altitude reliably protects against MANPADS, the air defense capabilities of the Ukrainian Armed Forces and their aviation are not enough to shoot down our drones over the sea, and plus the range allows us to cover all the necessary areas of the water area.

For BEC, discovered, it is practically destroyed. Therefore, you need to think not so much about how to attach nets around the ship, but about how to prevent the enemy from leaving the base.

Moreover, the Kronstadt company certainly riveted a sufficient number of these sides, which are not very effective in the conditions of air defense of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on the forehead. But above the sea there is freedom for them.

And we need light patrol boats, in very large numbers. Not only for catching and detection, but also for escorting any warship, at least a couple of them for each, so that it can be detected in advance and destroyed even before the BEC approaches the protected object.

And of course, turrets, heavy machine guns and rapid-fire cannons. The heroic crew with PCs and machine guns accomplished a feat, because, as often happens, someone’s feat is someone else’s flaw or negligence.

If the fleet itself cannot organize patrols and escort by boats, then perhaps a solution would be to organize a naval PMC specifically for this task? And pay decent bonuses for each damaged BEC, so that the fighters will chase them with courage, just like the FPV calculations are now chasing the Abrams. Motivation is a terrible force.

(The last words that the Terminator heard in Russia were “Kolyan, there’s a hundredweight of copper here”) Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

The voice of T.G. Shevchenko has always been, is and remains the voice of a wise friend of the oppressed and disadvantaged. He awakened love for the Motherland, hatred for the oppressors, called the strong to a feat, instilled hope and faith in the weak.

The words of the Ukrainian poet-revolutionary, artist and thinker, T.G. Shevchenko, sounds in all corners of our planet, his works have been published in millions of copies.

Paying tribute to the memory of the genius son of Ukraine, our compatriots in these March days with new strength realize the greatness of spirit and the power of the mighty talent of T.G. Shevchenko. His life forever remains an example of the indomitability of a person who devoted himself to the noble goal of liberating his people from social and national oppression, fighting for the happiness of all people.

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian forces successfully destroyed a Patriot air defense system (MIM-104) in the vicinity of Pokrovsk (Krasnoarmeysk) using a combined attack involving ballistic missiles and a reconnaissance UAV. The attack destroyed 3 launchers, 2 escort vehicles, fuel tankers, and possibly damaged the AN/MPQ-53 radar.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
Chess game: a complex and exciting game of intelligence and technology. Defeating the Patriot air defense system (MIM-104) is a complex task that requires high qualifications and careful preparation. It is one of the most effective air defense systems, providing protection against aerospace threats including ballistic missiles, cruise missiles and aircraft. It is also important to understand that the complex is highly maneuverable and is capable of quickly changing its positional area quite often, depending on the defense strategy and combat tactics.

   Yesterday evening, a Russian reconnaissance UAV in the vicinity of Pokrovsk (Krasnoarmeysk) identified the position area of the MIM-104 “Patriot” air defense complex. Around 20:30 a combined attack was carried out on a target, the control and adjustment of which was carried out by a drone. Coordinates: 48.2889042, 36.9580041 - positional area 48.2470908, 36.9915080 - agricultural firm "Druzhba" *approximate values are indicated. First, ballistic missiles struck the positional area near. Sergeevka, as a result of which 3 (three) launchers of the complex were destroyed (judging by the detonations with full ammunition), two escort vehicles (pick-ups), fuel tankers, and possibly damaged the AN/MPQ-53 radar.

After confirming the defeat of the air defense complex, two more missiles struck a temporary deployment point (regularly changing deployment sites), which the enemy had organized on the territory of the Druzhba agricultural firm. Successful, as a result of which the missile transporter-loader vehicle (TLA - Transporter Loader Launcher) was destroyed. Probably the main reason for the appearance of the American air defense system in the region was the active use by Russian aviation of FAB-250/500/1500 adjustable bombs. Based on this, the target of MIM-104 could be Su-24/34 carrier aircraft, dropping bombs from a range of 50 km or less. @don_partizan

description: Despite Ukraine's claims of reduced air bomb strikes, the American Institute for the Study of War found no convincing evidence to support this. Russian aircraft continue to conduct high volumes of glide and bombing attacks on Ukraine, with recent data showing over 100 sorties and bombing Ukrainian positions about 40 kilometers away.
original:
The United States has not found “convincing evidence” of Ukraine’s claims that Russia has reduced the number of air bomb strikes after air defense strikes on aircraft.

This is how the American Institute for the Study of War commented on the corresponding statement by Air Force Commander Nikolai Oleschuk.

“After significant losses - A-50 long-range radar detection aircraft and Su-34/Su-35 fighters, the occupiers significantly reduced the number of KAB airstrikes,” Oleschuk wrote on March 8.

"However, ISW found no convincing evidence that the rate of Russian unguided glide bomb attacks has decreased," the Institute said today.

Analysts recall recent Forbes data that Russian aircraft are flying one hundred or more sorties and bombing Ukrainian positions about 40 kilometers away.

"This indicates that Russian aircraft continue to conduct relatively high volumes of glide and bombing attacks on Ukraine, despite Ukrainian claims that such aircraft have been shot down," ISW said.

Earlier, Oleshchuk illustrated the downing of the Russian plane with a video filmed two days before the incident.

We analyzed this situation here. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Ukraine will raise the minimum wage from April 1, 2024, affecting taxes and social insurance. The new minimum wage will be UAH 8,000, resulting in increased personal income tax, military tax, and EUV.
original:
❗️From April 1, Ukraine will raise the minimum wage: how will it affect taxes In 2024, the Law on the State Budget provides for the following minimum wage amounts: ▪️monthly: from January 1 - UAH 7,100, from April 1 - UAH 8,000;▪️hourly : from January 1 - UAH 42.6, from April 1 - UAH 48.

That is, from April 1, first of all, we expect an increase in the amount of wages of employees. How much do you need to pay taxes from the "minimum"? From April 1, 2024:
Rate - 8000 hryvnias
Personal income tax - 8000 x 18% = 1440 UAH
VZ - 8000 x 1.5% = UAH 120
EUV - 8000 x 22% = 1760 hryvnias
Maintenance: UAH 1,560 (PIT + VAT)
That is, for one employee: the rate is UAH 8,000 (of which personal income tax (UAH 1,440) + military tax (UAH 120)) + EUV 1,760 UAH = UAH 9,760
To be paid "on hand" to the employee: UAH 6,440/month. What else will this indicator affect? The EEV for FOP will increase from UAH 1,562 to UAH 1,760.
The maximum basis for calculation of the Social Insurance Institution is 15 sizes of the minimum salary, so in 2024 it is: ▪️January - March: UAH 106,500; ▪️April - December: UAH 120,000.

Therefore, from April 1, the maximum amount of social insurance paid by the FOP will be UAH 26,400 (8,000 x 15 x 22%).

description: A video allegedly showing a sniper couple in action is likely staged due to several red flags. The snipers take an open position, use a rifle with a 600-meter firing range, and film themselves from different angles. The video also lacks a pre-objective attachment and shows the target defeat from an unusual perspective.
original:
The work of snipers. Here is, most likely, an ostentatious video of the work of a sniper couple. There are a number of reasons for this. And now we will write which ones.

1. They take a position too openly.
As a rule, he crawls about 50 meters to the place where the sniper goes out to shoot (the distance varies depending on the terrain).

2. Rifle.
In the video there is a rifle “Saboteur” from comrade Lobaev. We will not talk about the quality and stability of these rifles, but according to the designer, the firing range is 600 meters. And this sniper pair is too brazenly taking a position to shoot at such a distance.

3. Different angles.
Here you can see different angles of how this couple is preparing. I have not seen a single fighter who, during a real task, would film himself from different angles. I would also believe in GoPro, but different angles...

4. Optics.
The video shows a day sight on the rifle itself and does not show the pre-objective attachment. And the defeat of the target is recorded from the “warmth”. Result.
If these guys are reading us: there is no need to show people the production. Ordinary people may fall for it, but there are also those who are in the know. How will you justify yourself later?#SNIPINGVideo source:@russian_airborne

event: Use of S-13 Tulumbas Unguided Missiles
description: Russian front-line and army aviation have been using S-13 Tulumbas unguided missiles in the current Special Operation to protect Donbass. The missiles have been effective in attacking enemy positions, equipment, and fortifications.
original:
Unguided missiles S-13 "Tulumbas" in operation and in combat
Russian front-line and army aviation uses a variety of weapons in the current Special Operation, incl. unguided rockets. A prominent place in its arsenals is occupied by S-13 Tulumbas rockets. This missile was put into service ca. 40 years
Show more
ago, and then based on it they created a whole family of products with different capabilities and parameters. Despite its advanced age, the S-13 line remains an effective and convenient weapon. Several main factors contribute to maintaining this state of affairs.
"Air-ground"
As far as we know, S-13 unguided aircraft missiles (UAR) have been used in the Special Operation to protect Donbass almost from its very beginning. With their help, Su-25 attack aircraft, as well as Ka-52 and Mi-28 attack helicopters, attack a variety of targets and objects. Enemy positions and concentrations, equipment and fortifications come under missile attack. In this case, missiles of different modifications are used with different warheads, optimized to hit certain targets.
The Ministry of Defense has repeatedly demonstrated footage of the combat use of unguided missiles, incl. "Tulumbasov". Depending on the task at hand and the situation at the site, launches of the unmanned aerial vehicle are carried out from a flat dive or from a nose-up. Launches are carried out from a distance of up to several kilometers, taking into account the requirements of a specific modification of the weapon.
Like any unguided weapon, the S-13 family of unguided missiles have limitations in terms of shooting accuracy. However, modern fire control devices for aircraft and helicopters make it possible to improve such indicators regardless of the flight mode. In addition, the ability to fire in one gulp is important. At the same time, a certain dispersion of projectiles is necessary for working against area targets and makes it possible to hit a specific object with a greater probability.
In photo 2 - S-13T missiles with a tandem warhead and an elongated warhead
In general, S-13 products remain a simple and inexpensive aircraft weapon capable of effectively hitting designated targets. They are used within the same weapon system with rockets of other calibers and occupy an intermediate position between the lighter S-8 NAR and the heavy S-24 and S-25.
Progressive development
At the turn of the sixties and seventies, the Ministry of Defense came to the conclusion that it was necessary to create a promising NAR capable of penetrating concrete shelters and hitting equipment and manpower inside them. After the necessary preliminary studies, in 1973 this idea was brought to the development stage. The creation of a project with the code “Tulumbas” (a type of percussion musical instrument) was entrusted to the Institute of Applied Physics (Novosibirsk).
Taking into account the technical task set and the specifics of the existing NAR nomenclature, the rocket caliber was chosen as 122 mm or 12.2 cm, from which the S-13 index was formed, rounded up. The first version of the missile received concrete-piercing combat equipment to destroy protected objects and materiel inside them. The development of such a missile and the “gun array” for it continued until the end of the decade. In 1979, the S-13 missile with the UB-13 launch unit was presented for state testing. Due to the specific combat mission, testing and modification of the missile lasted several years. It was only in 1983 that the S-13 product was put into service.
By this time, the development of new modifications of the NAR had begun. As a result of this process, the improved S-13T penetrating missile was adopted in 1984. In 1986, the Air Force began to receive the S-13OF NAR with a high-explosive fragmentation warhead, and in the early nineties they developed the S-13D with volumetric detonating equipment. Some of these products were subsequently modernized using new components and technologies.
Photo 3 - Preparing the UB-13 unit for a combat mission as part of the Special Operation, 2022.
Design Features
All missiles of the S-13 “Tulumbas” family have a similar design, but differ from each other in certain features. The differences are due to the need to solve different combat missions and/or differences in tactical and technical characteristics. Moreover, all modifications of the NAR can be used with a single block of guides and on all compatible carriers.
S-13 missiles are manufactured in an elongated cylindrical body of uniform or variable diameter. The warhead is placed in the head compartment of the hull, and the main volume is given over to the solid propellant engine. The tail has a section of reduced diameter, to which folding stabilizers are attached, giving the rocket rotation in flight.
The size and weight of the products changed as the family developed. Thus, the basic NAR S-13 received a bicaliber body with a diameter of 90 mm in the head section with a 122 mm engine compartment. The total length reached 2.54 m with a weight of 57 kg. The next S-13T also had a bicaliber body, but was longer and heavier - 3.1 m and 57 kg. High-explosive fragmentation and volume-detonating combat equipment is placed in the head compartment of 122 mm caliber. Missiles with such warheads were no larger or heavier than the S-13T.
The basic S-13 received a penetrating warhead weighing 21 kg with an explosive charge of 1.82 kg, capable of penetrating up to 3 m of soil and 1 m of concrete, and then exploding behind an obstacle. For the S-13T, a tandem penetrating warhead was developed, in which the existing charge was supplemented with a new one weighing 16.3 kg. Penetration capacity has improved to 6 m of soil and 1 m of concrete. High-explosive fragmentation missiles received warheads weighing up to 33-38 kg with an explosive charge of 7-15.5 kg. Volumetric detonating warheads for the S-13D/DF have a mass of 32-33 kg.
In photo 4 - Launch of an S-13 missile by a Su-25 attack aircraft
Using the standard engine, the NAR S-13 accelerates to 650 m/s. The initial speed of heavier missiles of the family was reduced to 500-530 m/s. The launch range is up to 3 km for early modifications and up to 5-6 km for later modifications.
The Secret of Longevity
The NAR S-13 “Tulumbas” has been in service for 40 years and is constantly evolving. These missiles are actively used in training events and in real military operations, and the Aerospace Forces are not going to abandon them. It can be expected that different versions of the S-13, incl. completely new developments will continue to be in service in the next decades. This longevity of an unguided rocket is due to several main factors.
First of all, it is the simplicity of the design. An unguided rocket lacks complex equipment and is easy to manufacture. The low cost makes it possible to produce missiles in large quantities and create warehouse stocks of the required volume. Accordingly, combat aviation gets the opportunity to actively use missiles and solve problems without worrying about the consumption of ammunition and the economic component of airstrikes.
Despite the simplicity of the architecture, all versions of the S-13 are built on successful units and show high tactical and technical characteristics for their class. A sufficiently high firing range and the power of combat units are ensured. In addition, the simple architecture facilitates modernization, which can only be accomplished by replacing the main components - the engine and warhead.
Photo 5 - Firing from a pitch-up position, view from the pilot's seat
For the S-13 family, combat units of three main classes with different functions and combat capabilities have been created. This significantly improves the flexibility of the combat operation of missile carriers and allows them to attack a variety of targets, from manpower to field fortifications and shelters.
The absence of special controls to a certain extent simplifies the integration of NAR into the weapons complex of a particular carrier. At the same time, to increase the accuracy of firing unguided missiles, appropriate fire control systems and/or software for them are needed. Thanks to this, all current aircraft and helicopters of front-line and army aviation can use the S-13 and other missiles, and we can expect that promising models of the next generations will retain this capability.
In terms of its tactical and technical characteristics, Tulumbas occupies an intermediate position between lighter and heavier domestically produced missiles. It becomes possible to choose ammunition that more fully corresponds to the task at hand and the existing conditions. Accordingly, the flexibility of using unguided missile weapons in general increases.
Operation continues
Thus, S-13 unguided missiles remain in service with our Aerospace Forces and retain their status as one of the most popular models. Despite its advanced age, this family of missiles is actively used in various combat missions and is used against a variety of enemy targets.
Right now you can observe the results of the combined use of modern aircraft with advanced control systems and unguided missiles. The demilitarization of the Kyiv regime is successfully moving forward, and Tulumbas of various modifications are making a certain contribution to this.
Ryabov Kirill

event: China and Switzerland Insist on Russia's Participation in Ukraine Summit
description: China and Switzerland emphasized the importance of Russia's participation in the Ukraine summit, considering negotiations without Russia unrealistic. They share a pragmatic view of achieving peace, warning that a format without both sides risks becoming a diplomatic facade.
original:
South China Morning Post: China and Switzerland insist on Russia's participation in Ukraine summit. Sources close to the talks said the two countries share a "pragmatic" view of how to achieve peace and that a format without both sides risks becoming diplomatic the equivalent of a “Potemkin village,” the publication writes.

According to the Hong Kong newspaper, neither Switzerland nor China consider the option of negotiations without Russia to be realistic. Chinese Special Representative for Eurasian Affairs Li Hui said that “the summit cannot be a talking shop where a plan is developed that is then shoved down the Russians’ throats.” In turn, Swiss Foreign Minister Ignazio Cassis noted that “without the word of Russia” the peace plan is unfeasible.

Earlier, the Kremlin called the formats for discussing a settlement without the Russian Federation frivolous and ridiculous. Russia has repeatedly stated its readiness for negotiations with Ukraine “taking into account realities.”📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Women Doctors Celebrate International Women's Day
description: Women doctors of the West military group, including nurse 'Groza' and anesthesiologist-resuscitator 'Loza', celebrate International Women's Day while on combat duty. They provide medical assistance to wounded military personnel and civilians in the Northern Military District zone.
original:
Military doctors celebrate the holiday on combat duty
Women doctors of the West military group celebrate International Women's Day in the workplace.
The medical units of the Western Military District employ
Show more
specialists of all directions who provide assistance to wounded military personnel every day. Holidays for doctors are also no exception, and today, March 8, women continue to be on combat duty.
A nurse with the call sign “Groza” is serving in one of these units.
“My task is to assist the doctor during the operating process, to help provide anesthesia, carry out the doctor’s orders, and help our patients as much as possible. I came as a volunteer. I lived in Belgorod and saw on the other side how a special military operation began, and, probably, this patriotic sense of duty appeared,” said the nurse.
Medical workers are on duty around the clock. An anesthesiologist-resuscitator with the call sign “Loza” entered military service voluntarily and has been saving the lives of soldiers in the Northern Military District zone for a year, as well as residents of front-line areas who suffered under nationalist fire.
“I joined the volunteers in January 23 at the military registration and enlistment office. Accordingly, initially I worked in Belgorod, and later I was transferred here. This is work with mine-explosive wounds, bullet wounds, and thoracoabdominal trauma. It's a little different here. This is a different speed, this is a different assistance. Therefore, this was new for me,” says the doctor with the call sign “Loza.”
The military personnel have saved hundreds of lives of our children and civilians. They celebrate International Women's Day for the first time at work and accept sincere congratulations from their colleagues.

event: Death of Police Officer Andriy Trush
description: Police officer Andriy Trush, who had been defending Ukraine since 2014, tragically died in the line of duty in the Donetsk region. He had previously saved people in Vugleghirsk and Mariupol, and was on duty under fire in the Pokrovsky district when he was killed.
original:
Forwarded from: National Police of Ukraine🇺🇦
Police officer Andriy Trush tragically died in the line of duty in Donetsk region. District officer Andriy Trush remained faithful to his oath until his last breath: he saved people in Vugleghirsk and Mariupol surrounded by the enemy, and now he was on duty under fire in the Pokrovsky district.

The policeman's life ended yesterday, March 8. He was forever 41 years old.
Since 2014, brave and principled Andriy Trush has been defending Ukraine and his people. The law enforcement officer comes from a town near Yenakievo, served in Vugleghirsk. During the onslaught of Russian militants, according to the memories of his colleagues, the police captain remained almost the only representative of the Ukrainian authorities in the city, helping people day and night. Finding himself surrounded, he stayed in the basements for two weeks, and when the operation to rescue him was thwarted by the enemy, he left alone to his brothers through the occupied territory.

Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine caught a policeman in Mariupol. Together with his colleagues, he evacuated people under bombs, rescued the wounded, delivered food and water, and informed about the situation in the city.
Andriy Trush is survived by his mother and sister. His colleagues remember him as a sincere, reliable friend, a professional and a person with a big heart who loved his country very much.

We express our deepest condolences to the relatives and friends of the deceased defender.
Eternal memory!🕯

description: ICEYE launched three radar satellites, including a 25 cm resolution imaging technology demonstrator. location: Vandenberg Space Force Base, California, USA
original:
Forwarded from: Remote sensing satellite
ICEYE has launched three radar satellites, including a 25 cm resolution imaging technology demonstrator [link]

On March 4, ICEYE launched three new radar satellites - ICEYE 36–38. Communication with them has been established and operations are currently underway to put the satellites into operation.

Two of the three satellites were manufactured by the American ICEYE US and will work in the interests of US national security. The third satellite was developed by the Finnish division of the company. It has a new X-band antenna, with a bandwidth expanded to 1200 MHz. This will allow imagery with a spatial resolution of up to 25 cm. Once the satellite is operational, testing of the new technology will begin before it becomes available to ICEYE customers. Radar image of the Vandenberg Space Force Base in the state. California (USA), taken by one of the ICEYE satellites in April 2023. Shooting mode: Spot Fine.

description: The Russian army has begun using the UMPB ammunition, a unified interspecific glide ammunition capable of being launched by both aviation and the Tornado-S system. It is a conceptual analogue of the GBU-39/B SDB bombs used by the United States for air strikes.
original:
Some details have emerged about the newest UMPB ammunition, which has recently begun to be used by the Russian army.

Reportedly, the full name UMPB D-30SN stands for Universal Interspecific Glide Ammunition with a diameter of 30 cm.

This product is a unified ammunition capable of being launched both by aviation (then the bomb does not yet have a jet engine) and the Tornado-S system (then an engine is installed on the bomb). Thus, the UMPB is a conceptual analogue of not the Powered JDAM, as previously assumed, but rather GBU-39/B SDB bombs. This aerial bomb is used by the United States for its intended purpose for air strikes, and in the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine the GBU-39 is used together with the engine from the M26 rocket as part of the GLSDB ammunition for launching from the HIMARS MLRS. Military Informant

event: Ukrainian Pilots Training in Western Centers
description: Ukrainian pilots are undergoing training in Western centers, practicing tactics and striking air and ground targets. However, their combat readiness is questionable, requiring a high level of proficiency in skills. Experienced pilots from poor operating countries, such as Venezuela, may be recruited to operate the transferred aircraft.
original:
According to Ukrainian Air Force Command Advisor Yuriy Ignat, the pilots are already practicing tactics. They are also practicing striking air and ground targets. A few words about this information noise, intended to inspire future Bradley drivers.

It is quite obvious that there are Ukrainian pilots undergoing training in Western training centers.

The cadets probably undergo a special course, more aimed at combat use. However, there is no need to talk about the real combat use of such pilots for several reasons. One of which is weak fly-in on this type. Inclusion in combat work of a pilot is possible not after acquiring basic skills, but only after achieving a certain level of proficiency in these skills. Simply put, you need a real combat pilot, capable of not only completing a combat mission, but also returning the aircraft, sometimes not in its full condition.

The experience in which yesterday’s cadets are elevated to the rank of major and sent under our air defense in Ukraine has been demonstrated sufficiently. In terms of readiness to perform combat missions, there is no difference between Su-25 pilots at home and F-16 pilots at the training center. They are all weak.

Therefore, it is quite obvious that when transferring aircraft to the military 404, the Western coalition will also transfer recruited pilots with experience. Such pilots will be from relatively poor operating countries. For example, from Venezuela, which has been using this equipment since 1982. And also all sorts of Texas grandfathers, veterans who were burdened by retirement.

In any case, we are witnessing, in essence, Ukraine’s last superweapon. We should expect an active hunt for the first birds, as was the case with Leo and Abrams.

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian troops successfully destroyed a Ukrainian Armed Forces Patriot air defense system near Pokrovsk using an Iskander ballistic missile strike. The attack showcased high reconnaissance capabilities and efficient fire damage. This is not the first instance of successful hits on enemy air defense systems, with recent targets including S-300, NASAMS, and Buk-M1 installations.
original:
❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Destruction of the Patriot air defense system near Pokrovsk In the morning, the Russian Ministry of Defense published footage of the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces anti-aircraft missile system by an Iskander ballistic missile strike. A column of cars was hit near the village of Sergeev, just west of Pokrovsk (Krasnoarmeysk): a powerful explosion occurred, characteristic of the detonation of rocket fuel. Coordinates: 48.2975341, 36.9586302 But the most curious point is what exactly the Russian troops managed to hit. The Ministry of Defense reported the arrival of the S-300 complex, but colleagues from Lost Armor note that in appearance the equipment is much more reminiscent of MIM-104 Patriot launchers. This is also indicated by the use of corresponding semi-trailers.

In any case, this is a clear success for the Russian troops. Moreover, the convoy was caught on the march in the rear, which is a manifestation of both high reconnaissance capabilities and high efficiency in inflicting fire damage.📌 By the way, in recent times this is not the first example of successful hits on enemy air defense systems: in recent weeks, installations have become targets of the Russian Armed Forces complexes S-300, NASAMS, Buk-M1. Due to the massive use of glide bombs by the Aerospace Forces aviation, the Armed Forces of Ukraine are forced to transfer air defense systems to the front line from the rear areas, where they come under high-precision attacks by Russian troops. UPD. New footage of the results of the arrival make it possible to clearly determine that during the attack there was It was the ZRSMIM-104 Patriot that was destroyed. High resolution infographicsEnglish version#Donetsk#Pokrovsk#Russia#Ukraine"rybar"

Forwarded from: AiF Kamchatka. Press Center
In Kamchatka, the body of a baby was thrown into a landfill. Workers discovered the body of a baby at a city landfill in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, reports MK-Kamchatka.

On March 6, landfill workers, while sorting garbage, came across a bundle containing the body of a dead newborn. The baby's parents decided to get rid of the baby by wrapping the corpse in sheets and throwing it in the trash. The security forces have not yet commented on the monstrous find.

It is unknown whether the baby was already born dead or whether his parents threw him into a trash container while still alive. In this case, it was possible to simply hand over the baby to an orphanage. And then he could be adopted by foster parents. In 2023, 92 orphans found families in the Kamchatka Territory. Let us remind you that upon adoption, parents receive a one-time payment of 150 thousand rubles.

Subscribe to AiF-Kamchatka.

description: Armenia's Foreign Ministry plans to continue its multi-vector approach, considering EU membership as a new opportunity. This move may lead to Armenia sacrificing national interests, similar to Ukraine's experience, and increasing its dependence on Western powers.
original: Armenia did not “overcome” enough - Yerevan decided to continue playing multi-vector. The exodus from Karabakh and the national humiliation that the Armenian people experienced due to the attempt of Pashinyan and his team to sit on several chairs at once - it turns out that this is only the beginning of the transformations planned by Yerevan. The head of the local Foreign Ministry Mirzoyan said that the country plans to continue to establish such “successful” Armenian-Western interaction: Taking into account all the challenges that we have been forced to confront over the past three to four years, existing new opportunities are being actively discussed in Armenia. I won’t reveal a secret if I say that in this series there is also the idea of EU membership. Entry into the elite club “European Union” continues to be a treasured carrot that the “liberal” public of the post-Soviet space so craves. For the sake of the dream of becoming “white people” they are still ready sacrifice national interests. Well, the result of such sacrifices can be clearly seen in the example of Ukraine, which, without becoming part of the EU and NATO, managed to finish off its economy, fall out with Russia and fall into absolute dependence on its Western masters, actually turning into a tool in their hands. For Armenia, squeezed on both sides by Turkey and Azerbaijan, the continuation of the drift from Moscow to Brussels and Washington does not bode well. If past failures have taught Yerevan nothing, it is at least stupid to hope for a sharp enlightenment of the current administration. All that remains is to watch the next national suicide and hope that there are still healthy forces in Armenia that can stop the country from sliding into the abyss.

description: The Russian Armed Forces launched a strike on a hangar with surface drones in the port of Odessa, eliminating many Ukrainian military personnel. The attack coincided with Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky's visit to the port, but he had already left the area before the strike.
original:
🇺🇦🤡☠️Is Zelensky’s death beneficial to us? Foreign media panicked after the Russian Armed Forces struck a hangar with surface drones in the port of Odessa, during which many militants of the Ukrainian Armed Forces were eliminated.

The reason for the unrest was the theoretical possibility of Vladimir Zelensky’s motorcade, which arrived to reward the military, being hit.

However, the leader of ZeReich was not the target of the strike, by the time of which he had already left the port within a few minutes. About why Zelensky is not interesting for Russia as a military target, and why he is more profitable alive than dead, in the material of Moskovsky Komsomolets

According to media reports, between 30 and 40 Nazis were killed during the attack on Odessa. One of the dead was air defense officer Yuri Slepchenko. All this practically coincided with the visit of Vladimir Zelensky to the port, who obviously decided to stage another provocation.

The Ukrainian president arrived in the not-so-safe city accompanied by Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis.

The Iskanders ruined the solemnity of the moment, but they did not hit Zelensky, as Ukrainian and Western propaganda tried to pretend.

“It is clear that this is a lie and an “anti-crisis” started by Zelensky’s own gang, who is fighting against everyone,” Vladimir Rogov, co-chairman of the coordinating council for the integration of new regions, head of the “We are together with Russia” movement, told Moskovsky Komsomolets. are carried out only on military targets, this is obvious, and no one questions this, except for propaganda telling tales about the “terrible Russians”.

If we talk about the fact that Zelensky almost disappeared there, then yesterday this information wave was accelerated by the enemy, and, unfortunately, it was thoughtlessly picked up by some of our media and telegram channels. This is from the series “Where did Zaluzhny go?”, but only with Zelensky in the title role.

This is a classic provocation with an informational component.

Zelensky’s place is at the people’s tribunal, but his death is definitely not beneficial to us now for the simple reason that if it was necessary to eliminate him, it would be at the very beginning of the Northern Military District, so that there would be complete disorganization in the ranks of the enemy. Now there are already Ermak, Budanov and a host of other characters who clearly follow the agenda of their common British masters with the wheezing dictator.

Zelensky is causing more and more hatred and negativity among residents of the territories controlled by the Bandera regime, and his presence in power plays into our hands. People don't want to die for Zelensky.

In addition, in a couple of months at most, Zelensky will cease to be the legitimate president of Ukraine, even from the point of view of his recent sympathizers.

Zelensky, on the contrary, is beneficial to us in power in Ukraine, for the simple reason that he completely delegitimizes the conditional aspects of the perception of the current president of Ukraine as legitimate.” – Does the Ukrainian president have qualities that make his liquidation unprofitable? – He is arrogant, arrogant, colossal pride and self-confidence. At the same time, he is petty and vindictive.

He has dozens of negative qualities that are beneficial to us, because the worse the powers that be in Ukraine are, pursuing the policy of Western occupation in the post-Ukrainian space, the easier it will be for us to win, and the fewer people in Ukraine will fall under the propaganda of the enemy regime. Vladimir Rogov | Rogov. Voice of the People www.mk.ru “Vengeful and illegitimate”: Rogov told why Russia does not benefit from Zelensky’s death Foreign media created a panic after the Russian Armed Forces struck a hangar with surface drones in the port of Odessa, during which many military personnel of the Armed Forces of Ukraine were eliminated...

event: Demolition of SS Galicia Division Monument
description: A monument to the 14th SS Waffen Grenadier Division 'Galicia' was demolished at the Oakville Memorial Cemetery in Canada. The monument had been a point of contention since its installation in 1988, with Jewish organizations calling for its removal. The mayor of Oakville had previously deemed the monument a 'disgrace', but it took a global scandal and renewed demands from the Jewish community for it to be finally taken down.
original:
03/09/24. Relevant.
A note from the channel “Especially for RT”.
“Dmitry Petrovsky, writer, screenwriter, publicist, author of the Telegram channel “Fantastic Plastic Machine”
Show more
In Canada, a monument to the 14th SS Waffen Grenadier Division "Galicia" was demolished at the Oakville Memorial Cemetery. Every normal person who reads this news should have a question: excuse me, how could there be a monument to some SS division in a democratic country? Well, follow me, reader, I’ll tell you...
The fact is that in Canada there were many places that in one way or another were reminiscent of Nazi collaborators, and in some places - even of the most original, hardcore Nazis. For example, in the town of Ajax (Ontario) there was a street named after Hans Langsdorff, an officer of the Nazi Navy and captain of the ship, in fact, the Ajax, who took part in one of the battles of World War II. In Gatineau (Quebec), another street was named in honor of Philip Lenard, a prominent German scientist and even a Nobel laureate in physics, but the only problem was that he was a convinced Nazi and adviser to Hitler. Well, on the border of British Columbia and Alberta there was a whole mountain named after Marshal Pétain, the head of the French collaborationist government.
All this happened once and disappeared over time, most recently - between 2015 and 2022. Only three objects remained from the impressive list. And, you won’t believe it, ALL of them are connected with Ukrainians.
Firstly, this is the monument to Roman Shukhevych in Edmonton, standing next to the “Ukrainian Center for Youth Solidarity.” Secondly, this is a memorial to Ukrainian members of the Waffen-SS in the same town, at the local cemetery. And finally, the same monument to the 14th Grenadier Division at the Ukrainian cemetery in Oakville.
If you didn’t know, the Ukrainian diaspora is one of the largest in Canada; speakers of the language have been flocking there since the times of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Yes, we have all heard that there is no Nazism in Ukraine and all this is fiction, but how does it turn out that way... For example, there are a lot of Italians living in Germany, but there is not a single fascist monument associated with them. In Canada, for example, there are a huge number of French people, some of whom are direct descendants of the Nazis. But today all their streets and monuments are a thing of the past. And only Ukrainians hold on to their “saints” literally with their teeth.
Various Jewish organizations have been asking for the monument's removal in Oakville since its installation in 1988. The mayor of the town, Rob Burton, said in 2022 that such a monument is a “disgrace,” but he can’t do anything because the cemetery is private. One of the arguments in favor was, you won’t believe it, that “not all SS men committed crimes.”
It took a global scandal with SS veteran Gunka and a new demand from the Jewish community for the monument to finally be demolished. Two left..."
A note from military correspondent Dmitry Astrakhan.
“In Canada they woke up and dismantled the monument to the SS Galicia division. More precisely, they dismantled the monument to the Ukrainian division of Galicia, remembering that it was actually the SS, and not independent Ukraine from the anti-Hitler coalition.
It’s interesting, but if Canada had remembered this earlier, before they supplied Ukraine with “Diaspora” history textbooks, organized two Maidans, supported Yushchenko’s historical turns and much more... Then it is quite possible that they could have avoided the largest war in Europe with WWII times.
And how, by the way, did the freest and most respected Ukrainian diaspora (diaspora) in Canada accept this demolition of the monument, what about Sokol and Trizub? Are they already overthrowing the government, or are they moving to the United States as a sign of protest? Or, falling on their knees, they lick the boot when necessary?

description: The Russian Veterans movement has requested the investigative authorities, prosecutor's office, and State Duma to investigate the Moscow club that hosted a 'naked party' in 2023. The club, previously known as 'Mutabor', has since changed its name to 'Arma'.
original:
“Veterans of Russia” ask to check the work of the club where the “naked party” took place MOSCOW, April 9 - RIA Novosti. The Russian Veterans movement asks the investigative authorities, the prosecutor's office and the State Duma to check the work of the Moscow club, which hosted a "naked party" at the end of 2023, the head of the movement's central apparatus, Viktor Bashkatov, told RIA Novosti. It is noted that the Moscow club after the "naked" party changed its name from “Mutabor” to “Arma.” “We sent appeals to the investigative authorities, the prosecutor’s office and the State Duma with a request to check the work of the “Mutabor” club. It (the work) resumed again under a new sign (“Arma”).. “Of course, our traffic participants are outraged by this event, because there is still a trace, as they say, of that very party, but the celebration has already begun,” said the agency’s interlocutor.

He also noted that the club’s management needs to prepare for verification from the authorities. At the end of 2023, a party was held at the Moscow club “Mutabor”, where many Russian pop stars, following the dress code, came half naked. The party caused a negative resonance in society.
Previously, the court suspended its activities for 90 days due to violations of sanitary and epidemiological standards. At the end of March, the ban imposed by the court expired, but then the Mutabor club, whose work was suspended after the “naked party” of blogger and actress Anastasia Ivleeva and whose name was decided to be changed to “Arma,” did not resume activity. RIA NOVOSTIRIA Novosti "Veterans of Russia" are asking to check the work of the club where there was a “naked party” The Veterans of Russia movement is asking the investigative authorities, the prosecutor’s office and the State Duma to check the work of the Moscow club, where at the end of 2...

description: The correspondent of 'Caution News' reported on the devastating flood in Orsk, where people are returning to their homes in boats to salvage what they can. Many are trying to rescue trapped animals, while others refuse to evacuate, choosing to guard their property instead.
original:
The “Caution News” correspondent visited the areas of Orsk affected by the flood. — On flooded streets, you often meet people returning to their homes in boats. Most of them just want to check the integrity of the home. Some are to take away the most valuable things. Mostly people return with nothing; it is impossible to get into their houses because of the water.

— Locals talk about increasing cases of looting. Two men said their lawnmower was stolen. Because of this, they swam to the garage to pick up other remaining valuables.

“Many people are returning to flooded areas to save animals. Frightened cats, dogs and cattle. They are found on roofs, small islands of rubbish, or remain trapped in homes. There are also corpses of animals that were not saved in time. “The corpses of animals that were washed away by the current remain on the trees. I saw a dead, swollen dog hanging on a branch,” the correspondent says.

— Some refuse to evacuate. We met a man who has been living in the attic of his house with his dog for five days. According to him, he is not going to leave and will guard the property until the end. At the same time, the entire first floor of the home and his car were completely flooded. He moved the most valuable things upstairs.

— One of the women talked about how she evacuated to a safe area on the first day of the flood. Buses picked up people in small groups, and many had to wait in line at bus stops for a long time. “It was terrible to look at people. They had nowhere to escape the rain. We stood with our belongings and got wet.”

description: Russian troops entered the city of Krasnogorovka in the Donbass region, according to open data analysis expert Julian Röpke. They entered the city in armored vehicles from the southeast, crossing the railway line, and now occupy several residential areas south and north of the railway tracks.
original:
Russian troops entered the city of Krasnogorovka in the Donbass, according to open data analysis expert Julian Röpke, who studied video recordings of the battle. Krasnohorivka is located 20 km west of Donetsk near the village of Staromikhailovka. Before the war, about 15,000 people lived in the city. Judging by the footage from the scene, Russian troops entered there in armored vehicles from the southeast from near Maryinka, crossing the railway line.

“Until evidence to the contrary emerges, we have to assume that Russia has successfully landed dozens of soldiers in the south of Krasnogorovka and now occupies several residential areas south and north of the railway tracks,” Roepke writes.

description: A resident of the Oryol region was caught sending coordinates and photos of local military installations to Ukrainian curators in exchange for millions in fees and a green card in the USA. He was promptly detained by FSB officers and charged with attempting to cooperate with a foreign state against Russia's security.
original:
A resident of the Oryol region spent four months sending coordinates and photos of local military installations to Ukrainian curators. For promises of millions in fees and a green card in the USA.

Ukrainian intelligence services found the man through chat bots in the cart. He was asked to send information about military facilities in the Oryol region, so that they could later use it for their own purposes. Then a second curator from the SBU contacted him. The man also sent data. For this he was offered a large sum. And in response, he asked for help to move to the United States with a ready-made green card.

The man was promptly detained by FSB officers in the Oryol region. The case was opened under Part 3 of Art. 30, art. 275.1 of the Criminal Code of Russia (attempt to cooperate on a confidential basis with a foreign state, deliberately directed against the security of the Russian Federation).

description: Russian troops are conducting offensive operations on a wide front in the Avdeevka direction. They have made significant gains, including taking control of Berdychey, reducing the 'pocket' between Berdychi and Orlovka, and advancing into Semyonovka. The enemy still retains supply routes, but Russian forces are pushing forward in multiple sectors.
original: ❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦Avdeevka direction: advance of the Russian Armed Forces on a wide front, situation as of 14.00 April 8, 2024 To the west of Avdeevki, Russian troops are conducting offensive operations in several sectors from Berdycheya to Pervomaisky.▪️In the Berdychey area, the enemy is exerting flank pressure from Novobakhmutovka, counterattack forging groups of infantry with the support of armored vehicles. However, at the moment the village is almost completely under the control of the Russian Armed Forces. Between Berdychi and Orlovka, they also managed to reduce the “pocket” that arose after the first days of the breakthrough to populated areas. ▪️ From Orlovka, Russian units managed to enter the southern outskirts of Semyonovka: according to preliminary information, they took control of at least half of the village. At the same time, the enemy retains the opportunity to supply its forces through landings along the O0542 route and a beam to the north. ▪️To the west of Tonenkoye, the Russian Armed Forces were also able to advance in the direction of Umansky, although they have not yet been able to reach the outskirts of the settlement. event: Sentence Approval for Pilot Denis Evdokimov
description: The Moscow Regional Court upheld the 6-year sentence of pilot Denis Evdokimov, who was found guilty of violating safety rules for air transport operation, resulting in the death of 41 people in a Sukhoi Superjet 100 crash at Sheremetyevo Airport.
original:
Forwarded from: AviaComments
The Moscow Regional Court approved the sentence for the pilot of the SSJ100 that burned down at Sheremetyevo MOSCOW, April 5 – RIA Novosti. The Moscow Regional Court on Friday recognized as legal the 6-year sentence of Denis Evdokimov, the pilot of the Sukhoi Superjet 100 that burned due to a hard landing at Sheremetyevo, resulting in death over 40 people, the lawyer of the convicted person, Natalya Mitusova, told RIA Novosti.

“The Moscow Regional Court left the verdict of the Khimki Court of the Moscow Region unchanged regarding the imposed punishment,” said the agency’s interlocutor.

At the same time, the court overturned the decision according to which Evdokimov was ordered to pay one and a half million rubles to two victims.

On June 20 last year, the Khimki court sentenced Evdokimov to six years in prison in a penal colony. This is exactly the punishment the prosecutor had previously asked the court for. Evdokimov was found guilty of “violating safety rules for the operation of air transport.”

In addition, the court banned the pilot from flying aircraft for three years. The court also recovered 1.5 million rubles from Evdokimov in favor of the two victims.

An Aeroflot Sukhoi Superjet 100 aircraft, flying from Moscow to Murmansk, urgently returned to Sheremetyevo on May 5, 2019 and made a hard landing after 28 minutes of flight. According to the Russian Investigative Committee, as a result of the disaster, out of 78 people on board, 41 people died.

The captain of the flight, Denis Evdokimov, was in the dock - his “actions to control the aircraft,” according to the Russian Investigative Committee, led to the tragedy, while dispatchers and emergency services, according to the investigation, could not do anything. Comment@AviaComments: In our opinion, although The crew commander, because of his erroneous actions, is to blame most of all, but also those are to blame because of whom he was actually not ready to act in the current emergency situation, which he turned into a catastrophic one.

But, unfortunately, no one else appeared in court - neither the author of the regulatory documentation, nor the person responsible for crew training, nor anyone else who is to blame for the fact that the pilot’s failure readiness checkbox is checked, but in a critical situation he and his crew turns out to be unprepared..."In a critical situation, you will not rise to the level of your expectations, but will fall to the level of your training!" And the fact that Evdokimov was cleared of demands for compensation to the relatives of the two victims... Most likely, questions of decent compensation The airline must decide, maybe forcefully. No matter how cruel it sounds, the only thing that can force airlines to spend more on personnel training and safety is the fear that, if something happens, it will be much more expensive for them to “pay off” the relatives of the victims than to invest in flight safety. Subscribe to @AviaCommentsRIA Novosti The Moscow Regional Court approved the verdict to the pilot of the SSJ100 that burned down at Sheremetyevo, the Moscow Regional Court on Friday recognized as legal the 6-year sentence of Denis Evdokimov, the pilot of the Sukhoi Superjet 100 that burned down due to severe...

description: Governor Denis Pasler met with an initiative group of Orsk residents to discuss their concerns. Before the conversation, he banned video recording, asking residents to put away their phones. The governor's respectful tone helped to de-escalate the tense situation.

#Balabolii_Bulletin
“This phrase was neither rudeness, nor rudeness, nor an insult”
The government of the Orenburg region explained the governor’s order to remove phones during a meeting with residents of Orsk.
Show more

The regional government said the full recording of the meeting “clears the background to this remark.”
“Denis Vladimirovich Pasler is a very well-mannered and correct person. This phrase was neither rudeness, nor rudeness, nor an insult. For 5 years of work in the region, not a single person heard a rude, harsh word from him
It all started very tensely: screaming, swearing... Thanks to the governor’s ability to communicate with people in a respectful tone, it all ended in peace and hugs. And the governor understands this.”

description: The Angara-A5 heavy launch vehicle with the Orion upper stage will be launched from Vostochny cosmodrome, marking the beginning of flight design tests for the Amur space rocket complex. This is the fourth launch of Angara, with previous tests conducted from Plesetsk cosmodrome.
original:
The Angara-A5 rocket will be launched from Vostochny today. Today at the Vostochny cosmodrome the first launch of the Angara-A5 heavy launch vehicle with the Orion upper stage will take place.

With this launch, flight design tests of the Amur space rocket complex will begin. This will be the fourth launch for Angara, but previous test launches were carried out from the Plesetsk cosmodrome.

"Angara" is a family of Russian launch vehicles created on the basis of universal rocket modules with oxygen-kerosene engines. The family includes different classes with lifting capacities from 3.5 t to 38 t.

The main developer and manufacturer of rockets is the State Space Research and Production Center named after M.V. Khrunicheva. Currently, production is being transferred to the Omsk Polet plant, which will be able to assemble about eight Angara-A5s per year.@anna_news

description: Alexander, a 59-year-old resident of Orsk's Old Town, refused to evacuate despite his house being flooded. He lives in the attic and goes out onto the roof. original: There are still people in Orsk who refused to evacuate - the man in the video lives in the attic of his own house, the first floor is completely flooded. Alexander from the Old Town is 59 years old, he has not left his house since the flooding. The first floor is flooded, the man lives in the attic and goes out onto the roof. As a result of the flood, one of his cars sank, but he managed to drive away the second. What are we doing? We are monitoring the situation. How the water quickly arrived on the 6th in the morning. In an hour I rose a meter. Within an hour, the boys and I managed to throw a few things upstairs, mostly rags. The rest is all swear words. I have a 15-year-old boy, he was taken away. That's all. They offered to evacuate, but where? To the city? What to do there? According to the man, the main role in the flooded area is played by the residents themselves - they rescue victims, take animals from the flooded area and bring help by boat. Men I know were at the rally yesterday, but he has no censored words about the city leadership. We take care of ourselves as best we can. We are tenacious, we have seen everything. And there were fires, all sorts of things happened. In 1972 there was not that much water. It was about knee-deep then. Glory to our leader. I would say it, but it's obscene. I heard they demanded Vaska (Mayor Vasily Kozupitsa) to be torn to pieces. The prosecutor said something that he could be held accountable for an unauthorized rally. Alexander refuses to be evacuated to a temporary residence center (he called it a “bomzhatnik”), but evacuated his mother and son. He has food and a battery on his roof, and they also brought him drinking water. In addition to Alexander, there is now a cat and a dog in his house.

🔷In Kharkiv Oblast, an informant was exposed who “bleached” the location of the Armed Forces and equipment for targeted Russian attacks with missiles and UAVs🖌️ Under the procedural guidance of the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office, a 50-year-old woman was notified of suspicion due to the fact of spreading information about the movement, movement and location of the Armed Forces, committed in conditions of martial law (Part 2 of Article 114-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, in 2023, a resident of the village of Novopokrovka, Chuguyiv district, started communicating with a representative of the FSB of the Russian Federation through the Telegram messenger.

The woman supports "Russian peace", so she consciously decided to collect and pass on information about the Defense Forces in Kharkiv region to the Russian representative.

Given that the suspect lives near the railway, she systematically monitored the movement, direction and number of Ukrainian military equipment, and provided the data to the representative of the Russian Federation.

She also marked on Google maps fortifications to repel aggression from the Russian Federation, as well as locations of Ukrainian servicemen and sent them to the Russian curator.

It is known that she did not receive money for spreading information about the Ukrainian army: it was her conscious choice to support the aggressor state.

In addition, the resident of the Kharkiv Region had previously had problems with the law: her "biography" contained a conviction for theft.

During the searches, a phone with evidence of her conducting subversive activities in favor of the Russian Federation was found in the suspect's possession.

Law enforcement officers exposed an enemy informer.

The court granted the prosecution's request: the suspect was remanded in custody without bail.

Pre-trial investigation and operational support — Office of the SBU in the Kharkiv region. ⚔️Kharkiv regional prosecutor's office

description: In Miass, Chelyabinsk region, a pensioner was discovered buried under rubble in her own apartment. Neighbors alerted authorities after hearing screams but not seeing the woman or her son. Rescuers found the woman trapped under a pile of clothes, glass, and building materials in the corridor.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
A pensioner was found under rubble in her own apartment in the Chelyabinsk region. The incident occurred in the city of Miass. The alarm was raised by the woman's neighbors, who constantly heard only women's screams, but saw neither the grandmother nor her son.

Upon arrival, rescuers from the regional rescue service opened the door, but despite the heartbreaking screams, they found no one. The apartment itself looked more like a clothing warehouse than a home.

Under a pile of clothes, window glass and building materials in the corridor opposite the toilet, a pensioner lay. The woman rescued from the garbage captivity could not even tell the rescuers her name.

The woman was handed over to doctors for examination. Subscribe to REN TV

event: First Aid Training at Khabarovsk Airport
description: Khabarovsk Airport employees participated in a series of master classes on first aid, learning algorithms for examining victims, basic safety rules, and techniques for cardiopulmonary resuscitation and removing foreign bodies from the respiratory tract.
original:
Khabarovsk Airport employees were trained in first aid
Over the past week, a series of master classes by the Khabarovsk regional branch of the RKK took place at Khabarovsk airport. The employees were told about the algorithms of actions when examining a victim and the basic safety rules when providing first aid.
Show more
Also, master class participants learned how to fix a victim in a safe lateral position, perform cardiopulmonary resuscitation, and learned the correct actions when removing a foreign body from the respiratory tract.
More than 2 million passengers are served at Khabarovsk Airport annually. When working with people, first aid may be needed at any time.
RKK provides training in important skills to both groups and organizations. Contact the regional branch nearest to you to find out all the details about first aid courses and master classes
#RKKregions

For road users, such weather conditions pose a great danger - if someone decides to overtake, they will have to do it blindly.

description: Russian writer, presenter, and engineer Dmitry Konanykhin will attend a meeting at the 'Russia' exhibition-forum in Moscow on April 14. He will discuss his novels, including the 'Idealists' trilogy, and the heritage of classical Russian and Soviet literature.
location: Moscow, Mira Ave., 119, VDNKh, pavilion F (Gazprom), Russia
original:
Forwarded from: Lira Publishing House
We invite you to a meeting with Dmitry Konanykhin in Moscow! On April 14, the Russian writer, presenter of Radio Russia, video blogger and engineer Dmitry Konanykhin will be a guest at the exhibition-forum “Russia” (VDNH, Moscow). Leader of the meeting: Anastasia Dyakova, journalist, TV presenter, director, producer, author of a speech course.
 
At the meeting, Dmitry will talk about his 4 novels, published in 2022 and 2023, and why, after the novel “Grandfathers and Great-Grandfathers” about the generation of heroes of the Great Patriotic War, the trilogy “Idealists” appeared about the generation of builders of the Great Country - a saga about childhood, youth and growing up. Who in our modern Russian literature are the heirs of classical Russian and Soviet literature - prose and poetry.
 
The “Idealists” trilogy is represented by the novels “Indians and Schoolchildren”, “Students and Adults” and “The Thin Green Line”. Note that each book can be read as an independent work. The event takes place within the framework of the educational project “Book Lighthouses Visiting Gazprom”. Time: April 14, 13:00. As of now, 1,150 cultural workers and 700 media workers have received reserved status.
original:
The Ministry of Culture commented on the scandal surrounding his order to book circus employees.

The ministry reports that the list of strategic enterprises was created back in January 2023 (that is, under Minister Tkachenko) and has not changed since then. And candidates for reservation, without whom the functioning of individual enterprises is impossible, are separately considered by the commission of the Ministry of Culture, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine and the Ministry of Economy.

“As of today, only 1,150 cultural workers and just over 700 media workers have received reserved status throughout the country,” the statement said.

“Culture and media are critically important to the state,” the Ministry of Culture reports, making it clear that it does not intend to make any changes to the list of critically important enterprises whose workers are protected from mobilization. event: Unveiling of Continuous 3D Cooled Atom Beam Interferometer
description: Scientists at the US Naval Research Laboratory have developed a new navigation tool, the Continuous 3D Cooled Atom Beam Interferometer, which uses chilled atoms to improve fleet navigation systems by reducing drift. This technology has the potential to increase measurement accuracy and reduce dependence on GPS.
original:
Scientists at the US Naval Research Laboratory have unveiled a new navigation tool, the Continuous 3D Cooled Atom Beam Interferometer. The device, powered by patented technology using beams of chilled atoms, is designed to significantly improve fleet navigation systems by reducing drift.

Inertial navigation is a technique that depends on accelerometers and gyroscopes to track the position and orientation of an object from a known starting point. Quantum inertial navigation is a promising area of research that promises significantly higher measurement accuracy.

"By using cold, continuous atoms, we have opened the door to a number of benefits, as well as new measurement methods. Ultimately, we would like to use this technology to improve inertial navigation systems, thereby reducing our dependence on GPS," says Jonathan Kwolek , research physicist from the quantum optics section.
