The court hearing was held behind closed doors. The second person involved in the case, Ufa activist Rustem Mulyukov, was left by the court without changes to his sentence: 2.5 years in prison.

Chanysheva’s lawyer, Sergei Makarenko, said that tightening the sentence is “an order from the authorities, which was carried out by the judiciary,” reports RusNews. “Lilya will be rehabilitated, the case will be reviewed and she will be released,” the lawyer emphasized. In the summer of 2023, Chanysheva was sentenced to 7, 5 years in prison for “calls for extremism” and “participation in the activities of an extremist community.”

In March 2024, the prosecutor's office demanded that Chanysheva's sentence be increased to ten years. The prosecutor motivated this by the fact that Chanysheva “provoked and incited Ufa residents to protest.” Photo: SotaVision / Telegram Subscribe to Dozhdya’s Telegram Watch us on YouTube

#Middle_East@mpre_view1

Show more

Show more
Eight-year-old Ilya Tolpykin, who was shot down by terrorists near Crocus, has been discharged from the hospital.
The child currently uses a wheelchair. The fact is that the boy’s collarbone is broken, and his hip was literally assembled piece by piece. The rod is now inserted into the bone. The mother of the young athlete told reporters about this.
The child will begin to stand on his feet in about a couple of weeks. Then the boy will be able to move not in a wheelchair, but on crutches. Ilya is in good spirits and is already planning to return to the ice to continue playing hockey. After the tragedy, famous athletes supported the boy, and the players of his team placed stickers on the court and on their helmets: “We are with you.”
8-year-old Ilya, who was run over by terrorists near Crocus, has been discharged from the hospital. While the child will move in a wheelchair.

The boy will begin to get back on his feet in about two weeks, when his broken collarbone heals. Then the student will be allowed to walk with crutches. In total, rehabilitation is expected to take another couple of months.

description: A forced evacuation of residents has begun in the Kurgan region due to severe flooding. The Tobol River has reached a critical level, rising 3.5 meters in one day and continuing to rise rapidly. Authorities have declared a state of emergency, and rescuers and police are conducting door-to-door visits to urge residents to leave their homes and move to temporary accommodation centers.
original:
Urgent evacuation of residents began in the Kurgan region. The level of the Tobol River has approached a critical level and has already reached almost 9 meters - in one day the water has risen by 3.5 meters and continues to rise rapidly.

According to SHOT, in the Zverinogolovsky district, the regional authorities have already announced a forced evacuation of residents - at the moment, rescuers and police are carrying out door-to-door visits, waking up people and urging them to leave their homes and move to prepared temporary accommodation centers.

Earlier, a state of emergency was declared in the region due to severe flooding, and schoolchildren were transferred to distance learning. It is expected that the peak of the flood will occur from April 11 to April 14, but in settlements located in the floodplain of the Tobol River, the next 24 hours may become difficult.

description: During the Battle of Arras on the Western Front, the Royal Flying Corps suffered catastrophic losses, losing 245 aircraft, 211 aircrew killed or missing, and 108 captured. German aviation, led by Manfred Richthofen, claimed 89 victories, while the RFC's average pilot life expectancy was only 3 weeks.
original:
#not_returned Bloody April 1917 was a period in the military history of British aviation during the First World War, when the Royal Flying Corps suffered catastrophic losses.
On April 9, the Battle of Arras began on the Western Front. The RFC (Royal Flying Corps) forces consisted of 25 squadrons, up to 365 aircraft, of which about a third were fighters. The French squadrons were withdrawn for restoration.
At the beginning of the battle, German aviation in this area had 5 fighter squadrons (German Jasta), later their number was increased to 8. In total there were about 80 fighters (according to other sources - 114).
With the advent of the Albatros D.II and D.III aircraft, Germany gained air superiority on the Western Front from September 1916. By April 1917, the basis of the Allied reconnaissance and bomber aircraft were the vulnerable B.E.2, F.E.2 and Sopwith 1½ Strutter, fighter aircraft - DH.2, F.E.8, Nieuport 17 and Martinsyde G.100. Only SPAD S.VII, Sop with Pup and Sop with Triplane could fight on equal terms with German fighters, but there were few of them. The new generation of Allied fighters (S.E.5, Sopwith Camel, SPAD S.XIII) has not yet entered service.
During April 1917, the British lost 245 aircraft, 211 aircrew were killed/missing and 108 were captured. In total, during the period from April 1 to May 5, 1917, more than 300 British aircraft were destroyed. Jasta 11 under the command of Manfred Richthofen alone claimed 89 victories, Richthofen himself claimed about 20 victories. German aviation lost 66 aircraft in all respects. For comparison, over the 5 months of the Battle of Somme in 1916, the RFC lost 576 aircraft. During this period, the average life expectancy of a British pilot at the front was 3 weeks.
The losses hit the RFC hard, but the Germans were never able to completely stop the main activities of the RFC: aerial photography, reconnaissance flights and bombing. In addition, I will give a couple more articles: from “Zen” from “Military Equipment of the World” and “VKontakte” from “MILITARIA” .

description: Sikorsky, an aircraft designer, expressed his nationality as Russian, despite having Ukrainian roots. He compared Ukraine to a US state, stating that his family considered themselves Russian, part of a larger Russia.
original:

In 1936, Sikorsky expressed his position as follows:

"My family is originally Ukrainian, from a village in the Kiev region, where my grandfathers were priests. But we consider ourselves Russian, from a part of Russia, given the Ukrainian nationality, in the same way that Texas or Louisiana are part of the United States." .▪️Zhulyani Airport, Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, as well as the street where the American Embassy in Kyiv is now located, are named after Sikorsky.@Sputnik_Tajikistan

description: A vegetable warehouse in Kaliningrad received a shipment of bananas from Germany, but instead found 76 kg of cocaine hidden beneath the fruit. The warehouse employees alerted the authorities, who seized the drugs and opened a criminal case. The driver, a 44-year-old Belarusian, was involved in the failed drug trafficking attempt.
original:
Drug traffickers mistakenly sent cocaine instead of Colombian bananas to a vegetable warehouse in Kaliningrad. Operatives seized more than 76 kg of the substance.

An April Fool's joke took Victoria Baltia LLC by surprise - while unloading boxes of bananas, vegetable warehouse employees found 76 compressed briquettes with drugs under a layer of fruit. The deputy director was informed, and he called the police. The cargo itself followed the route Germany - Lithuania - Kaliningrad. And the bananas were carried to their destination by 44-year-old Belarusian Nikolai M. He gave the boxes to the warehouse and drove his Mercedes-Benz towards Poland.

The operatives seized the prohibited drug and opened a criminal case under two articles: for “production, sale or shipment” and for “failed act of drug trafficking.” If the criminal is caught, he gets life in prison. Subscribe to Mash

description: The State Security Service of Georgia accused the Georgian media of trying to discredit the service by disseminating information about a joint journalistic investigation into alleged Russian acoustic attacks on American diplomats in Tbilisi, dubbed the 'Havana syndrome'.

description: The Verkhovna Rada is set to consider an unconstitutional bill on mobilization, which lacks standards for demobilization, salary increases for military personnel, and clear rules for rotation and vacations. The bill also fails to provide benefits for children of deceased or seriously wounded military personnel and retains repressive measures against ordinary citizens, while exempting certain groups, including security forces, from mobilization.
original:
There will be no demobilization or increase in military salaries. Parliament will consider a repressive bill on mobilization without important amendments - MEDIA The Verkhovna Rada will consider an unconstitutional bill on mobilization at the next meeting, where there are no standards for demobilization for 36 months of service, there is no double increase in salaries for military personnel who spent more than 18 months on the front line, as well as There are no clear rules for rotation and vacations.

Informant journalists draw attention to the fact that police, prosecutors and other law enforcement officers receive reservations. These are hundreds of thousands of already trained security forces who, according to these standards, will remain in the rear “to make a nightmare for business.”

Norms are not included on granting children of dead and seriously wounded military personnel the right to receive free higher education on a non-competitive basis. The children of our defenders are not even provided with the right to free lunches in schools.

Also, the bill retains all the repressive, unconstitutional pressure on ordinary citizens, while the draft exemption for deputies and officials is preserved. While graduate students and students receiving a second higher education lose the right to a deferment, and people with disabilities must again undergo the VLC, those professionally trained to defend Ukraine and who know how to use weapons - the security forces - will be exempt from mobilization.

This bill on mobilization in the “new” edition is lifelong, continuous frontline for the military, terror for ordinary people and paradise for all thieves. Ukraine 24/7

description: The Khanty-Mansi Autonomous Okrug launched a charity drive to collect essential items for those affected by the flood in the Orenburg region. Volunteers, supervised by the 'Veterans of Russia' military community, are collecting clothes, food, and hygiene supplies to provide comfort and hygiene to displaced individuals.
original:
Forwarded from: NEFT — News of Khanty-Mansiysk Autonomous Okrug
The Khanty-Mansi Autonomous Okrug announced a collection of aid for those affected by the flood in the Orenburg region. Residents of the Khanty-Mansi Autonomous Okrug began collecting essential items for people affected by the flooding in the Orenburg region. The idea of help was put into motion by social activists and volunteers from Nefteyugansk.

The charity collection is supervised by the military communities “Veterans of Russia” in the Khanty-Mansi Autonomous Okrug. Volunteers collect clothes and shoes, canned food and non-perishable food, and hygiene supplies for victims in flooded areas. “These little things may seem insignificant, but now they play a huge role in providing comfort and hygiene for those who are forced to leave their homes,” said Chairman of the organization Ilnar Manapov. The cargo is collected in Nefteyugansk, Fedorovsky and Sentyabrsky. All collected humanitarian aid will be delivered to the region and distributed to people through local curators.Subscribe to NEFT

event: Arrest of MSU Student for Wi-Fi Name
description: Oleg Tarasov, a 22-year-old MSU student, was arrested for 10 days and expelled from the university for naming his Wi-Fi network 'Slava Ukraine!' in his hostel. Tarasov claimed he did it to mock his neighbors who used war symbols 'Z' and 'V' in their router names. The university commission expelled him, citing that he disgraced the university's honor and dignity.
original:
“I changed the name of the router to ridicule the people who on my floor used Z and V in the names of the routers,” - arrested for 10 days for Wi-Fi “Slava Ukraine!” MSU student is appealing the decision of the court and the university commission on expulsion. Earlier it became known that 22-year-old Oleg Tarasov, who received 10 days of arrest for calling the wifi network “Slava Ukraine!” in the hostel, expelled from Moscow State University.

The commission at which the decision was made to expel Tarasov allegedly took place while the young man was in a pre-trial detention center. He was not allowed to read the protocol.

After Tarasov’s arrest, he was summoned to the training unit and forced to write an explanatory note. In it, he said that he changed the name to “Slava Ukraine!” to make fun of his neighbors on the floor, who began using the war symbols “Z” and “V” in the names of their routers. After this, Tarasov was summoned to a commission, where he was confronted with the fact that he had already been expelled - due to the fact that he allegedly disgraced the honor and dignity of the university. ASTRA had at its disposal an audio recording of this “meeting”, at which Deputy Dean of the Faculty of Public Administration Nikonov reminded Tarasov that he was studying at Moscow State University on a budget, that “our country and its armed forces are conducting military training in Ukraine,” and called the student’s act “immoral.”

The young man plans to appeal the court decision. “If this succeeds, then there will be no grounds for my expulsion, because in the order they refer to the court decision,” he told ASTRA.

According to him, he changed the name of the router a long time ago, but “it came to light” after a denunciation - as he assumes, by one of the students. The case file says that Tarasov was reported by a certain person who, calling the police, introduced himself with a fake name. Oleg also has the text of the denunciation at his disposal. According to him, he did not personally communicate with the informer.

description: A dam in Orsk broke on Friday evening, causing concern among local residents who had noticed water and bubbles appearing from the dam earlier in the week. Despite their efforts to report the issue and prevent the break, authorities assured them everything was fine, and the dam specialist claimed it would withstand water. The mayor even inspected the dam two days before the break, stating it would bear the load.
original:
Forwarded from: RBC
The dam, which broke on Friday evening in Orsk, caused concern among people living nearby several days before the break, local residents told RBC. According to them, in the middle of the week, water began to appear from the “dry” part of the dam, bubbles began to appear.

Concerned Orchan residents monitored the condition of the dam on their own, patrolling it even at night. They also called a special commission through the district administration to assess the condition of the structure. “They said everything is fine, don’t worry. There was even a dam specialist there who told us: “Why are you causing panic? Why are you calling us, we also run [to every call], we always look. Everything is fine, everything is solid, it will withstand water,” local residents told RBC. It was April 3, two days before the breakthrough.

The mayor of the city, Vasily Kozupitsa, inspected the dam on April 4. “I’m sure it will bear the load that will come here,” he wrote following the results. Residents tried to prevent a breakthrough on their own - one of them drove his tractor to the dam and tried to cover the leak with earth. They also called a priest to the dam. Read more about how flooded Orsk lives in the RBC report.

description: Soldiers from the 4th brigade's artillery division, including one with the call sign Syndrome, practiced using Grad in the Ukrainian Armed Forces. Syndrome explained that his call sign originated from his healthy lifestyle as a teenager. The main task of artillery is to demoralize and weaken the enemy, making it easier for infantry to deal with them.
original:
During attacks in the area of Kleshcheevka (DPR) and the village of Krasnoye, soldiers from the artillery division of the 4th brigade practice Grad in the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

One of them has the call sign Syndrome. The military man explained to RT military correspondent Vlad Andritsa@vandrytsa that this is due to his healthy lifestyle:

“When we were teenagers, someone there smoked, drank, and something else. And I was in a company where there were athletes... And they thought that I was sick with something, so I became attached.”

The main task of artillery, according to Syndrome, is to cut off the enemy’s approaches to our positions: “And if someone approached, he should already be demoralized, wounded, shell-shocked, so that it would be easier for our infantry to deal with them.”

More details on the video.#Military CorpsRThttps://vk.com/video-66833222_456302218VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 4 min 35 s from 9 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! Views: 208. Likes: 2.

description: Russian forces launched an attack under the cover of a smoke screen, targeting identified enemy reserves to prevent a counterattack. Artillery strikes were concentrated on dachas south of the city, beyond the canal line.
original:
Chasov Yar - morning 04/09/24: what are these two videos talking about... As usual, the military really doesn’t like to share information, but they often post interesting videos.

This morning, first Video 1 and then Video 2 appeared on our channels. Judging by the reference points to the area (the tower in both videos and the church in the Kanal microdistrict in the second video), the dense cloud of smoke in Video 1 is located approximately here ( see map). And artillery strikes (in both videos) are concentrated on dachas to the south of the city and located already beyond the canal line (also see the map).

How can I interpret them. It looks like today our people went on the attack under the cover of a smoke screen. In this case, strikes are carried out against identified enemy reserves so that they cannot launch a counterattack.

It is still unclear how it all ended. I really hope the attack was successful and this will help us reach the channel.

I think the situation will clear up by evening...

event: Court Upholds Fine Against Human Rights Activist
description: The Supreme Court of Crimea, established by the Russian Federation, refused to cancel the fine imposed on human rights activist Lutfiya Zudieva. Zudieva's lawyer, Emil Kurbedinov, plans to appeal the decision, citing violations in the case, including the unauthorized drawing up of protocols by the Ministry of Internal Affairs.
original:
A Russian court in Crimea refused to cancel the fine of human rights activist Lutfiya Zudieva. The decision was made by the Supreme Court of Crimea, created by the Russian Federation. Zudieva's lawyer, Emil Kurbedinov, stated that he intends to appeal this decision.

Kurbedinov also drew attention to the violations committed in this case. In particular, the lawyer noted that according to the Code of Administrative Offenses of Russia, the Ministry of Internal Affairs is not authorized to draw up protocols on violation of the article under which Zudieva was fined.

Zudieva herself noted that in this way Russian security forces are interested in stopping the activities of human rights defenders in Crimea, as they shed light on human rights violations on the annexed peninsula.

Zudieva was fined 2,500 rubles at the end of March for “abuse of freedom of mass information.” The reason was the reposting of Radio Liberty materials from two years ago without mentioning that the specified media outlet was recognized in the Russian Federation as a foreign agent.

event: Poland Requests Nuclear Weapons from US
description: Polish President Andrzej Duda has requested the deployment of nuclear warheads on Polish territory as part of the NATO Nuclear Sharing program. This is not the first time Poland has made such a request, with the US previously denying similar requests. The Polish government is likely seeking to strengthen its position before getting involved in the conflict in Western Ukraine.
original:
🇵🇱🇺🇸The Polish government is again asking the Americans for nuclear weapons.

Polish President Andrzej Duda said that it was extremely advisable to achieve the deployment of nuclear warheads on the territory of the republic within the framework of the NATO Nuclear Sharing program. At the same time, he prudently added that, in principle, “he does not see the possibility of starting a nuclear war,” it’s just that now, so to speak, is a good moment.📌Nuclear Sharing is a program of NATO member states for the deployment and storage of the American nuclear arsenal in Europe. It provides that the governments of these countries can also participate in planning and exercises related to this type of weapon. The desire of the Poles to become part of the nuclear program and the constant refusals of the Americans are as stable as the ebb and flow of the tides. Conversations about this come up on average once every few months and it is quite logical that they were started again.

The last time the Polish authorities received a rather sharp answer from Washington, the arguments of which cannot be argued with. The State Department indicated that the United States does not intend to deploy nuclear weapons in Poland and other countries that joined NATO after 1997. On what basis they did not specify, but Poland entered the alliance in 1999 along with Hungary and the Czech Republic, and the mincemeat is not turning back. It is quite obvious that the Poles continue to try to beg for bargains before getting bogged down as “cannon fodder” in the all-too-calm Western Ukraine. Considering that the Belarusians have nuclear Iskanders on the same border, it is logical that Warsaw also wants to have at least some argument before the suicide mission.#USA#Poland@rybartogether with @pl_syrenkaSupport uswww.gazetaprawna.plSpecjalnie dla DGP. event: Meeting between President of Kyrgyzstan and Azerbaijani Foreign Minister
description: President Sadyr Japarov of Kyrgyzstan met with Azerbaijani Foreign Minister Jeyhun Bayramov to discuss bilateral cooperation in trade, economic, humanitarian, cultural, educational, and other spheres. They emphasized the importance of utilizing the Middle Corridor's transit opportunities to strengthen economic cooperation and continuing coordinated activities within international and regional organizations.
original:
President of Kyrgyzstan Sadyr Japarov received Azerbaijani Foreign Minister Jeyhun Bayramov, who is visiting the country. At the meeting, it was noted that active political dialogue between the countries contributes to successful bilateral cooperation in trade, economic, humanitarian, cultural, educational and other spheres.

It was emphasized that the use of transit opportunities of the Middle Corridor by the countries of Central Asia, including Kyrgyzstan, will serve to strengthen economic cooperation.

The importance of continuing coordinated activities and mutual support within the framework of international and regional organizations, in particular within the UN, the Organization of Turkic States, and the Organization of Islamic Cooperation, was noted.

Jeyhun Bayramov said that this year Azerbaijan will host the 29th session of the Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (COP29), within the framework of which there will be an additional opportunity for active cooperation between Azerbaijan and Kyrgyzstan.

 Japarov noted that Azerbaijan and Kyrgyzstan have deepened interstate relations in recent years and expressed satisfaction with the activities of the Interstate Council.

It was emphasized that dynamically developing and strengthening bilateral relations make it possible to expand interaction between parliaments, governments and line ministries.@Caucasian_bureau

description: Russia extended an invitation to Ukraine to participate in the World Friendship Games, held in Yekaterinburg. The invitation was sent to Ukrainian sports federations.

description: In Nizhny Tagil, police and special forces raided a computer club, detaining a gamer who was playing as terrorists in Counter Strike. The gamer was taken down and pinned to the floor. The motive behind the detention is currently unknown.
original:
Forwarded from: E1.RU | Ekaterinburg News
In Nizhny Tagil, police, accompanied by special forces, burst into a computer club and detained a gamer who was playing for terrorists at that moment.

The guy was literally torn from the computer and laid on the floor. All this was caught on video.

The footage shows three security forces in helmets and body armor and two in civilian clothes running in, putting the gamer face down on the floor and fixing him in front of his amazed neighbor. He even threw down the keyboard and mouse and moved further away so as not to interfere with the special operation. “This happened on April 3.” A young guy, about twenty years old, was at that moment playing Counter Strike as terrorists, and then not virtual, but real special forces jumped on him. “Very unexpected,” one of the eyewitnesses who shared the video told @e1_news. What crime the gamer is charged with is still unknown.

Counter-Terrorist win

description: Ukrainian Armed Forces militant Leonid Grishchenko was killed in the special operation zone. He had planned to propose to his girlfriend in May 2023 after purchasing a ring, but instead chose to serve in the 72nd Brigade named after the Black Cossacks.
original:
“Already bought a ring”: a Ukrainian militant was eliminated on the eve of his engagement. A Ukrainian Armed Forces militant, Leonid Grishchenko, was killed in the special operation zone. Information about this was confirmed by his relatives on Monday, April 8.

At the end of the conflict, the Ukrainian Armed Forces officer planned to have a wedding: in May 2023, he purchased a ring for his girlfriend. However, he preferred service to family life: he joined the 72nd Brigade named after the Black Cossacks and went to the east, because his best friend served there, who, by the way, was also liquidated.

“He wrote to me - mom, I ordered a ring. We also corresponded with him. I say, well done. This is what we have, he says, there will be one movement, it’s planned. And after this movement, he says, I will have a vacation, and I will come, I will propose to Tonya,” recalls Grishchenko’s mother.

Having learned that Grishchenko had been liquidated, his girlfriend took the initiative to establish a training scholarship for the military and name it in honor of her fiancé. Local authorities approved the idea, and a scholarship named after Grishchenko was founded at the Kyiv School of Public Administration. However, now the Ukrainian woman is looking for financial donors who could pay funds to the military, since they do not plan to allocate money from the state budget for these needs. Know more from Ukraine.ru

description: A shelling incident in the Poltava region resulted in 12 injuries, including two children, and one fatality. The attack also damaged multiple residential buildings and vehicles.
original:
The number of residents of an apartment building in the Poltava region injured as a result of shelling has increased to 12. Among them are two children, reports the head of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine Igor Klimenko. One person died, 12 were injured.

Also, according to him, two more three-story houses, one four-story house and about a dozen cars were damaged.

description: Russia continues to launch daily attacks on Ukrainian energy facilities, Kharkov, and civilians. Former US State Department special envoy Kurt Volker emphasizes the need for Ukraine to disable Russian refineries in response.
original: Ukraine must continue to disable Russian refineries, says former US State Department special envoy Kurt Volker: “People must realize that there is a war going on. Every day Russia attacks Ukrainian energy facilities, they attack Kharkov, they attack civilians, they attack everything.”

original:
Forwarded from: Administration of Zaporozhye region
The First Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration arrived in Energodar. The First Deputy Head of the Presidential Administration, Sergei Kiriyenko, visited the Zaporozhye NPP in the city of Energodar, where he held a meeting with the leadership of the city and the station.

event: Ceremonial Transfer of Land for Garden of Peace
description: A ceremonial transfer of land took place at the 'Sharp Grave' memorial complex in Crimea, marking the 80th anniversary of its liberation from Nazi invaders. The land will be used to establish the Garden of Peace in the Krasnogvardeysky district.
location: Krasnogvardeysky District, Republic of Crimea, Russia
original:
The ceremonial transfer of land for the establishment of the Garden of Peace in Crimea took place at the “Sharp Grave”
As part of the international campaign (https://luganmedia.ru/2024/04/09/na-ostroj-mogile-pro..) Garden of Peace and Memory of Defenders of the Fatherland “Ring of Grace” at the memorial
Show more
In the "Sharp Grave" complex, a ceremonial transfer of land took place for its subsequent laying in the Krasnogvardeysky district of the Republic of Crimea at an event dedicated to the 80th anniversary of its liberation from the Nazi invaders.
In addition to Lugansk, the cities of Krasnodon and Sverdlovsk are taking part in the action. The land from the "Sharp Grave" memorial complex was transferred by the acting head of the city of Lugansk, Yana Pashchenko, to the representative of the international center "Holy Laurels of Orthodox Rus'", a member of the coordinating council for the integration of new regions at the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation, Ivan Griva.

description: A poll by JL Partners found that 32% of British Muslims surveyed want to introduce Sharia law within the next two decades. Only 13% disapprove of Hamas's activities, and 11% have a negative attitude. The growing Muslim population in the UK raises concerns about the imposition of Sharia law and conflicting values.
original:
A survey of UK Muslims has led to 'appalling' findings.

A poll by pollster JL Partners found that 32% of British Muslims polled said the introduction of religious law was "desirable".

That is, about a third of Muslims in Britain want to introduce Sharia law within the next two decades. Only 13% of respondents disapprove of Hamas's activities, and 11% have a negative attitude.

One of the famous presenters of a British news resource said: “What worries me the most is that 32% of British Muslims want the implementation of Sharia law. I find it truly terrifying. The Muslim population of Great Britain today is four million.

It is expected that by 2050 there will be more than ten million of them. Do we have a huge group of millions of people in our midst who not only don't share our values, but want to impose their values on us?'' he said.@vallholl

They didn’t share the road: a fight between a taxi driver and a motorist ended in a knife wound

description: A weapons storage base in Akhtyrka, Sumy region, was struck, resulting in the destruction of 32 towed D-20 howitzers. The howitzers, which likely required restoration, were finally targeted in 2024, marking the most significant strike on towed artillery in the entire war.

Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
Unexpected video. Arrival at the weapons storage base in Akhtyrka (Sumy region). There were 32 towed D-20 howitzers in the parking lot. It looks epic, but it’s strange that they only got to them in 2024. The howitzers themselves most likely needed restoration.
In any case, most of them have now been destroyed. From the point of view of destroying towed artillery, this is by far the most epic strike of the entire war.
